title: Meet LG’s Radio+, a Music Streaming Service
description: The service will go live for users in Korea and the United States. The post Meet LG’s Radio+, a Music Streaming Service appeared first on Phandroid.
author: Mike Viray
excerpt: The service will go live for users in Korea and the United States.
text: LG recently announced the launch of LG Radio+, an ad-supported music streaming platform which will be available on the company’s smart TVs with webOS 6.0 and newer. LG says that users will be able to access a wide library of podcasts and radio programs, and will work with the LG ThinQ app for smart devices. LG adds that it’s partnered with global radio and audio provider Radioline which provides users with access for news, sports, music and more. The service will go live for users in Korea and the United States, and will come with over 14,500 channels in the U.S. and 440 in Korea. A dedicated LG Radio+ app can also be accessed from the Content Store or Apps.
